00091 static int
00092 noteErr(const char *fmt, ...) {
00093     struct timeval t;
00094     va_list ap;
00095     struct ccn_charbuf *b = ccn_charbuf_create();
00096     ccn_charbuf_reserve(b, 1024);
00097     gettimeofday(&t, NULL);
00098     ccn_charbuf_putf(b, "** ERROR: %s\n", fmt);
00099     char *fb = ccn_charbuf_as_string(b);
00100     va_start(ap, fmt);
00101     vfprintf(stderr, fb, ap);
00102     va_end(ap);
00103     fflush(stderr);
00104     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&b);
00105     return -1;
00106 }

00112 static int 
00113 parseAndAccumName(char *s, struct SyncNameAccum *na) {
00114     int i = 0;
00115     for (;;) {
00116         char c = s[i];
00117         int d = SyncDecodeUriChar(c);
00118         if (d <= 0) break;
00119         i++;
00120     }
00121     char save = s[i];
00122     s[i] = 0;
00123     struct ccn_charbuf *cb = ccn_charbuf_create();
00124     int skip = ccn_name_from_uri(cb, (const char *) s);
00125     s[i] = save;
00126     if (skip <= 0) {
00127         // not legal, so don't append the name
00128         ccn_charbuf_destroy(&cb);
00129         return skip;
00130     }
00131     // extract the size, which is the next numeric string
00132     // (no significant checking here)
00133     intmax_t size = 0;
00134     for (;;) {
00135         char c = s[i];
00136         if (c >= '0' && c <= '9') break;
00137         if (c < ' ') break;
00138         i++;
00139     }
00140     for (;;) {
00141         char c = s[i];
00142         if (c < '0' || c > '9') break;
00143         size = size * 10 + SyncDecodeHexDigit(c);
00144         i++;
00145     }
00146     // finally, append the name in the order it arrived
00147     SyncNameAccumAppend(na, cb, size);
00148     return skip;    
00149 }
00150 
00151 static struct SyncNameAccum *
00152 readAndAccumNames(FILE *input, int rem) {
00153     struct SyncNameAccum *na = SyncAllocNameAccum(4);
00154     static int tempLim = 4*1024;
00155     char *temp = NEW_ANY(tempLim+4, char);
00156     while (rem > 0) {
00157         // first, read a line
00158         int len = 0;
00159         while (len < tempLim) {
00160             int c = fgetc(input);
00161             if (c < 0 || c == '\n') break;
00162             temp[len] = c;
00163             len++;
00164         }
00165         temp[len] = 0;
00166         if (len == 0)
00167         // blank line stops us
00168         break;
00169         // now grab the name we found
00170         int pos = 0;
00171         static char *key = "ccnx:";
00172         int keyLen = strlen(key);
00173         int found = 0;
00174         while (pos < len) {
00175             if (strncasecmp(temp+pos, key, keyLen) == 0) {
00176                 // found the name start
00177                 parseAndAccumName(temp+pos, na);
00178                 found++;
00179                 break;
00180             }
00181             pos++;
00182         }
00183         if (found == 0) {
00184             // did not get "ccnx:" so try for "/" start
00185             for (pos = 0; pos < len; pos++) {
00186                 if (temp[pos]== '/') {
00187                     parseAndAccumName(temp+pos, na);
00188                     break;
00189                 }
00190             }
00191         }
00192         rem--;
00193     }
00194     free(temp);
00195     return na;
00196 }

00198 ////////////////////////////////////////

00202 static void
00203 printTreeInner(struct SyncTreeWorkerHead *head,
00204                struct ccn_charbuf *tmpB,
00205                struct ccn_charbuf *tmpD,
00206                FILE *f) {
00207     int i = 0;
00208     struct SyncTreeWorkerEntry *ent = SyncTreeWorkerTop(head);
00209     struct SyncHashCacheEntry *ce = ent->cacheEntry;
00210     if (ce == NULL) {
00211         fprintf(f, "?? no cacheEntry ??\n");
00212         return;
00213     }
00214     struct SyncNodeComposite *nc = ce->ncL;
00215     if (nc == NULL) nc = ce->ncR;
00216     if (nc == NULL) {
00217         fprintf(f, "?? no cacheEntry->nc ??\n");
00218         return;
00219     }
00220     for (i = 1; i < head->level; i++) fprintf(f, "  | ");
00221     char *hex = SyncHexStr(nc->hash->buf, nc->hash->length);
00222     fprintf(f, "node, depth = %d, refs = %d, leaves = %d, hash = %s\n",
00223             (int) nc->treeDepth, (int) nc->refLen, (int) nc->leafCount, hex);
00224     free(hex);
00225     ssize_t pos = 0;
00226     while (pos < nc->refLen) {
00227         struct SyncNodeElem *ep = &nc->refs[pos];
00228         ent->pos = pos;
00229         if (ep->kind & SyncElemKind_leaf) {
00230             // a leaf, so the element name is inline
00231             struct ccn_buf_decoder nameDec;
00232             struct ccn_buf_decoder *nameD = NULL;
00233             nameD = SyncInitDecoderFromOffset(&nameDec, nc, ep->start, ep->stop);
00234             ccn_charbuf_reset(tmpB);
00235             ccn_charbuf_reset(tmpD);
00236             SyncAppendElementInner(tmpB, nameD);
00237             ccn_uri_append(tmpD, tmpB->buf, tmpB->length, 1);
00238             for (i = 0; i < head->level; i++) fprintf(f, "  | ");
00239             fprintf(f, "%s\n", ccn_charbuf_as_string(tmpD));
00240         } else {
00241             // a node, so try this recursively
00242             SyncTreeWorkerPush(head);
00243             printTreeInner(head, tmpB, tmpD, f);
00244             SyncTreeWorkerPop(head);
00245         }
00246         pos++;
00247     }
00248 }
00249 
00250 static void
00251 printTree(struct SyncTreeWorkerHead *head, FILE *f) {
00252     struct ccn_charbuf *tmpB = ccn_charbuf_create();
00253     struct ccn_charbuf *tmpD = ccn_charbuf_create();
00254     printTreeInner(head, tmpB, tmpD, f);
00255     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&tmpB);
00256     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&tmpD);
00257 }
00258 
00259 static void putMark(FILE *f) {
00260     struct timeval mark;
00261     gettimeofday(&mark, 0);
00262     fprintf(f, "%ju.%06u: ",
00263             (uintmax_t) mark.tv_sec,
00264             (unsigned) mark.tv_usec);
00265 }

00271 // generate the encoding of a test object 
00272 static struct SyncNodeComposite *
00273 testGenComposite(struct SyncBaseStruct *base, int nRefs) {
00274     int res = 0;
00275     struct SyncNodeComposite *nc = SyncAllocComposite(base);
00276     struct ccn_charbuf *tmp = ccn_charbuf_create();
00277     
00278     // append the references
00279     while (nRefs > 0 && res == 0) {
00280         ccn_charbuf_reset(tmp);
00281         res |= SyncAppendRandomName(tmp, 5, 12);
00282         SyncNodeAddName(nc, tmp);
00283         nRefs--;
00284     }
00285     
00286     SyncEndComposite(nc); // appends finals counts
00287     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&tmp);
00288     
00289     nc->err = res;
00290     return nc;
00291 }

00293 static int
00294 testEncodeDecode(struct SyncTestParms *parms) {
00295     struct SyncBaseStruct *base = parms->base;
00296     struct ccn_charbuf *cb = ccn_charbuf_create();
00297     cb->length = 0;
00298     ccnb_element_begin(cb, CCN_DTAG_Content); // artificial!  only for testing!
00299     fwrite(cb->buf, sizeof(unsigned char), cb->length, stdout);
00300     
00301     struct SyncNodeComposite *nc = testGenComposite(base, 4);
00302     
00303     SyncWriteComposite(nc, stdout);
00304     
00305     struct ccn_buf_decoder ds;
00306     struct ccn_buf_decoder *d = SyncInitDecoderFromCharbuf(&ds, nc->cb, 0);
00307     struct SyncNodeComposite *chk = SyncAllocComposite(base);
00308     SyncParseComposite(chk, d);
00309     SyncWriteComposite(chk, stdout);
00310     SyncFreeComposite(chk);
00311     
00312     int pos = cb->length;
00313     ccnb_element_end(cb);  // CCN_DTAG_Content
00314     fwrite(cb->buf+pos, sizeof(unsigned char), cb->length-pos, stdout);
00315     fflush(stdout);
00316     
00317     SyncFreeComposite(nc);
00318     
00319     cb->length = 0;
00320     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&cb);
00321     
00322     return 0;
00323 }

00325 static int
00326 testReader(struct SyncTestParms *parms) {
00327     char *fn = parms->inputName;
00328     int sort = parms->sort;
00329     FILE *f = fopen(fn, "r");
00330     int res = 0;
00331     if (f != NULL) {
00332         int64_t startTime = SyncCurrentTime();
00333         struct SyncNameAccum *na = readAndAccumNames(f, MAX_READ_LEN);
00334         fclose(f);
00335         struct ccn_charbuf *tmp = ccn_charbuf_create();
00336         int i = 0;
00337         IndexSorter_Base ixBase = NULL;
00338         int accumNameBytes = 0;
00339         int accumContentBytes = 0;
00340         if (sort > 0) {
00341             IndexSorter_Index ixLim = na->len;
00342             ixBase = IndexSorter_New(ixLim, -1);
00343             ixBase->sorter = SyncNameAccumSorter;
00344             ixBase->client = na;
00345             IndexSorter_Index ix = 0;
00346             for (; ix < ixLim; ix++) IndexSorter_Add(ixBase, ix);
00347         }
00348         struct ccn_charbuf *lag = NULL;
00349         for (;i < na->len; i++) {
00350             int j = i;
00351             if (ixBase != NULL) j = IndexSorter_Rem(ixBase);
00352             struct ccn_charbuf *each = na->ents[j].name;
00353             if (sort == 1 && lag != NULL) {
00354                 int cmp = SyncCmpNames(each, lag);
00355                 if (cmp < 0)
00356                 return noteErr("bad sort (order)!");
00357                 if (cmp == 0)
00358                 return noteErr("bad sort (duplicate)!");
00359             }
00360             struct ccn_charbuf *repl = each;
00361             accumNameBytes = accumNameBytes + repl->length;
00362             ssize_t size = na->ents[j].data;
00363             accumContentBytes = accumContentBytes + size;
00364             ccn_charbuf_reset(tmp);
00365             ccn_uri_append(tmp, repl->buf, repl->length, 1);
00366             if (sort != 2) {
00367                 fprintf(stdout, "%4d", i);
00368                 if (sort) fprintf(stdout, ", %4d", j);
00369                 fprintf(stdout, ", %8zd, ", size);
00370             }
00371             fprintf(stdout, "%s\n", ccn_charbuf_as_string(tmp));
00372             lag = each;
00373             if (repl != each) ccn_charbuf_destroy(&repl);
00374         }
00375         int64_t dt = SyncDeltaTime(startTime, SyncCurrentTime());
00376         dt = (dt + 500)/ 1000;
00377         fprintf(stdout, "-- %d names, %d name bytes, %d content bytes, %d.%03d seconds\n",
00378                 na->len, accumNameBytes, accumContentBytes,
00379                 (int) (dt / 1000), (int) (dt % 1000));
00380         if (ixBase != NULL) IndexSorter_Free(&ixBase);
00381         ccn_charbuf_destroy(&tmp);
00382         na = SyncFreeNameAccum(na);
00383     } else {
00384         return noteErr("testReader, could not open %s", fn);
00385     }
00386     return res;
00387 }
00388 
00389 static int
00390 testReadBuilder(struct SyncTestParms *parms) {
00391     FILE *f = fopen(parms->inputName, "r");
00392     int ns = parms->nSplits;
00393     int res = 0;
00394     
00395     if (f != NULL) {
00396         struct SyncRootStruct *root = parms->root;
00397         
00398         if (root == NULL) {
00399             // need a new one
00400             struct ccn_charbuf *topo = ccn_charbuf_create();
00401             ccn_name_from_uri(topo, "/ccn/test/sync");
00402             
00403             struct ccn_charbuf *prefix = ccn_charbuf_create();
00404             ccn_name_from_uri(prefix, "/ccn/test");
00405             
00406             root = SyncAddRoot(parms->base,
00407                                parms->syncScope,
00408                                topo,
00409                                prefix,
00410                                NULL);
00411             parms->root = root;
00412             ccn_charbuf_destroy(&topo);
00413             ccn_charbuf_destroy(&prefix);
00414         }
00415         
00416         if (root->namesToAdd != NULL)
00417         SyncFreeNameAccum(root->namesToAdd);
00418         
00419         struct SyncLongHashStruct longHash;
00420         int split = 0;
00421         memset(&longHash, 0, sizeof(longHash));
00422         longHash.pos = MAX_HASH_BYTES;
00423         for (;;) {
00424             int i = 0;
00425             if (ns == 0) {
00426                 root->namesToAdd = readAndAccumNames(f, MAX_READ_LEN);
00427             } else {
00428                 int p = 0;
00429                 int k = parms->splits[split];
00430                 if (split > 0) p = parms->splits[split-1];
00431                 if (k <= 0 || k >= ns) {
00432                     return noteErr("splits: bad k %d", k);
00433                     break;
00434                 }
00435                 if (p < 0 || p >= k) {
00436                     return noteErr("splits: bad p %d", k);
00437                     break;
00438                 }
00439                 root->namesToAdd = readAndAccumNames(f, k-p);
00440             }
00441             
00442             if (root->namesToAdd == NULL || root->namesToAdd->len <= 0)
00443             // the data ran out first
00444             break;
00445             
00446             for (i = 0; i < root->namesToAdd->len; i++) {
00447                 SyncAccumHash(&longHash, root->namesToAdd->ents[i].name);
00448             }
00449             // TBD: fix this -- SyncUpdateRoot(root);
00450             
00451             struct ccn_charbuf *hb = SyncLongHashToBuf(&longHash);
00452             struct ccn_charbuf *rb = root->currentHash;
00453             if (rb->length != hb->length
00454                 || memcmp(rb->buf, hb->buf, hb->length) != 0) {
00455                 // this is not right!
00456                 char *hexL = SyncHexStr(hb->buf, hb->length);
00457                 char *hexR = SyncHexStr(rb->buf, rb->length);
00458                 res = noteErr("hexL %s, hexR %s", hexL, hexR);
00459                 free(hexL);
00460                 free(hexR);
00461                 return res;
00462             }
00463             ccn_charbuf_destroy(&hb);
00464             
00465             struct SyncHashCacheEntry *ce = SyncRootTopEntry(root);
00466             struct SyncTreeWorkerHead *tw = SyncTreeWorkerCreate(root->ch, ce);
00467             switch (parms->mode) {
00468                 case 0: {
00469                     // no output
00470                     break;
00471                 }
00472                 case 1: {
00473                     // binary output
00474                     SyncWriteComposite(ce->ncL, stdout);
00475                     break;
00476                 }
00477                 case 2: {
00478                     // text output
00479                     SyncTreeWorkerInit(tw, ce);
00480                     printTree(tw, stdout);
00481                     fprintf(stdout, "-----------------------\n");
00482                     break;
00483                 }
00484                 default: {
00485                     // no output
00486                     break;
00487                 }
00488             }
00489             
00490             // release intermediate resources
00491             tw = SyncTreeWorkerFree(tw);
00492             split++;
00493             if (ns > 0 && split >= ns) break;
00494         }
00495         
00496         fclose(f);
00497         return 0;
00498         
00499     } else {
00500         return noteErr("testReadBuilder, could not open %s", parms->inputName);
00501     }
00502 }

00504 // generate a simple canned root for routing
00505 // based on anticipated root for the routing info
00506 static struct SyncRootStruct *
00507 genTestRootRouting(struct SyncTestParms *parms) {
00508     struct SyncBaseStruct *base = parms->base;
00509     struct ccn_charbuf *topoPrefix = ccn_charbuf_create();
00510     struct ccn_charbuf *namingPrefix = ccn_charbuf_create();
00511     
00512     ccn_name_from_uri(topoPrefix, "/ccn/test/sync");
00513     ccn_name_from_uri(namingPrefix, "/ccn/test/routing");
00514     struct SyncRootStruct *root = SyncAddRoot(base,
00515                                               parms->syncScope,
00516                                               topoPrefix,
00517                                               namingPrefix,
00518                                               NULL);
00519     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&topoPrefix);
00520     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&namingPrefix);
00521     return root;
00522 }

00524 // generate a simple canned root for repos
00525 // based on anticipated root for the routing info
00526 static struct SyncRootStruct *
00527 genTestRootRepos(struct SyncTestParms *parms) {
00528     struct SyncBaseStruct *base = parms->base;
00529     struct ccn_charbuf *topoPrefix = ccn_charbuf_create();
00530     struct ccn_charbuf *namingPrefix = ccn_charbuf_create();
00531     
00532     ccn_name_from_uri(topoPrefix, "/ccn/test/sync");
00533     ccn_name_from_uri(namingPrefix, "/ccn/test/repos");
00534     
00535     struct SyncNameAccum *filter = SyncAllocNameAccum(4);
00536     struct ccn_charbuf *clause = ccn_charbuf_create();
00537     ccn_name_from_uri(clause, "/PARC");
00538     SyncNameAccumAppend(filter, clause, 0);
00539     
00540     struct SyncRootStruct *root = SyncAddRoot(base,
00541                                               parms->syncScope,
00542                                               topoPrefix,
00543                                               namingPrefix,
00544                                               filter);
00545     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&topoPrefix);
00546     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&namingPrefix);
00547     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&clause);
00548     SyncFreeNameAccum(filter);
00549     
00550     return root;
00551 }
00552 
00553 static struct SyncRootStruct *
00554 testRootCoding(struct SyncTestParms *parms, struct SyncRootStruct *root) {
00555     struct SyncBaseStruct *base = parms->base;
00556     struct ccn_charbuf *cb1 = ccn_charbuf_create();
00557     int res = 0;
00558     SyncRootAppendSlice(cb1, root);  // generate the encoding
00559     
00560     SyncRemRoot(root);  // smoke test the removal
00561     
00562     struct ccn_buf_decoder ds;
00563     struct ccn_buf_decoder *d = SyncInitDecoderFromCharbuf(&ds, cb1, 0);
00564     root = SyncRootDecodeAndAdd(base, d);
00565     if (root == NULL) {
00566         res = noteErr("SyncRootDecodeAndAdd, failed");
00567     }
00568     if (res ==0) {
00569         // we have a root
00570         struct ccn_charbuf *cb2 = ccn_charbuf_create();
00571         SyncRootAppendSlice(cb2, root);
00572         
00573         if (res == 0) {
00574             // compare the encoding lengths
00575             if (cb1->length == 0 || cb1->length != cb2->length) {
00576                 res = noteErr("testRootCoding, bad encoding lengths, %d != %d",
00577                               (int) cb1->length, (int) cb2->length);
00578             }
00579         }
00580         if (res == 0) {
00581             // compare the encoding contents
00582             ssize_t cmp = memcmp(cb1->buf, cb2->buf, cb1->length);
00583             if (cmp != 0) {
00584                 res = noteErr("testRootCoding, bad encoding data",
00585                               (int) cb1->length, (int) cb2->length);
00586                 res = -1;
00587             }
00588         }
00589         ccn_charbuf_destroy(&cb2);
00590     }
00591     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&cb1);
00592     
00593     if (res == 0) return root;
00594     
00595     SyncRemRoot(root);
00596     return NULL;
00597     
00598 }
00599 
00600 static int
00601 testRootLookup (struct SyncTestParms *parms, struct SyncRootStruct *root,
00602                 char * goodName, char * badName) {
00603     int res = 0;
00604     // now try a few lookups
00605     struct ccn_charbuf *name = ccn_charbuf_create();
00606     ccn_name_from_uri(name, goodName);
00607     enum SyncRootLookupCode ec = SyncRootLookupName(root, name);
00608     if (ec != SyncRootLookupCode_covered) {
00609         res = noteErr("testRootLookup, good name not covered, %s",
00610                       goodName);
00611     }
00612     ccn_charbuf_reset(name);
00613     ccn_name_from_uri(name, badName);
00614     ec = SyncRootLookupName(root, name);
00615     if (ec != SyncRootLookupCode_none) {
00616         res = noteErr("testRootLookup, bad name not rejected, %s",
00617                       badName);
00618     }
00619     return res;
00620 }
00621 
00622 static int
00623 testRootBasic(struct SyncTestParms *parms) {
00624     int res = 0;
00625     struct SyncRootStruct *root = NULL;
00626     
00627     struct ccn_charbuf *cb = ccn_charbuf_create();
00628     uintmax_t val = 37;
00629     res |= SyncAppendTaggedNumber(cb, CCN_DTAG_SyncVersion, val);
00630     
00631     if (res == 0) {
00632         struct ccn_buf_decoder ds;
00633         struct ccn_buf_decoder *d = ccn_buf_decoder_start(&ds, cb->buf, cb->length);
00634         if (SyncParseUnsigned(d, CCN_DTAG_SyncVersion) != val
00635             || d->decoder.state < 0)
00636         res = -__LINE__;
00637     }
00638     
00639     if (res < 0) {
00640         return noteErr("testRootBasic, basic numbers failed, %d", res);
00641     }
00642     
00643     // test no filter
00644     root = genTestRootRouting(parms);
00645     root = testRootCoding(parms, root);
00646     res = testRootLookup(parms, root,
00647                          "ccnx:/ccn/test/routing/XXX",
00648                          "ccnx:/ccn/test/repos/PARC/XXX");
00649     SyncRemRoot(root);
00650     if (res < 0) return res;
00651     
00652     // test with filter
00653     root = genTestRootRepos(parms);
00654     root = testRootCoding(parms, root);
00655     res = testRootLookup(parms, root,
00656                          "ccnx:/ccn/test/repos/PARC/XXX",
00657                          "ccnx:/ccn/test/routing/XXX");
00658     SyncRemRoot(root);
00659     if (res < 0) {
00660         return noteErr("testRootBasic, failed");
00661     }
00662     
00663     return res;
00664 }
00665 
00666 static int
00667 localStore(struct SyncTestParms *parms,
00668            struct ccn *ccn, struct ccn_charbuf *nm, struct ccn_charbuf *cb) {
00669     int res = 0;
00670     struct ccn_charbuf *template = SyncGenInterest(NULL,
00671                                                    1,  // always local
00672                                                    parms->life,
00673                                                    -1, -1, NULL);
00674     struct ccn_charbuf *tmp = ccn_charbuf_create();
00675     ccn_create_version(ccn, nm, CCN_V_NOW, 0, 0);
00676     ccn_charbuf_append_charbuf(tmp, nm);
00677     ccn_name_from_uri(tmp, "%C1.R.sw");
00678     ccn_name_append_nonce(tmp);
00679     ccn_get(ccn, tmp, NULL, DEFAULT_CMD_TIMEOUT, NULL, NULL, NULL, 0);
00680     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&tmp);
00681     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&template);
00682     if (res < 0) return res;
00683     
00684     struct ccn_charbuf *cob = ccn_charbuf_create();
00685     struct ccn_signing_params sp = CCN_SIGNING_PARAMS_INIT;
00686     const void *cp = NULL;
00687     size_t cs = 0;
00688     if (cb != NULL) {
00689         sp.type = CCN_CONTENT_DATA;
00690         cp = (const void *) cb->buf;
00691         cs = cb->length;
00692     } else {
00693         sp.type = CCN_CONTENT_GONE;
00694     }
00695     ccn_name_append_numeric(nm, CCN_MARKER_SEQNUM, 0);
00696     sp.sp_flags |= CCN_SP_FINAL_BLOCK;
00697     res |= ccn_sign_content(ccn,
00698                             cob,
00699                             nm,
00700                             &sp,
00701                             cp,
00702                             cs);
00703     res |= ccn_put(ccn, (const void *) cob->buf, cob->length);
00704     // ccn_run(ccn, 150);
00705     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&cob);
00706     return res;
00707 }
00708 
00709 static int
00710 sendSlice(struct SyncTestParms *parms,
00711           char *topo, char *prefix,
00712           int count, char **clauses) {
00713     // constructs a simple config slice and sends it to an attached repo
00714     struct ccn_charbuf *cb = ccn_charbuf_create();
00715     struct ccn_charbuf *hash = ccn_charbuf_create();
00716     struct ccn_charbuf *nm = ccn_charbuf_create();
00717     int i = 0;
00718     int res = 0;
00719     res |= ccnb_element_begin(cb, CCN_DTAG_SyncConfigSlice);
00720     res |= SyncAppendTaggedNumber(cb, CCN_DTAG_SyncVersion, SLICE_VERSION);
00721     res |= ccn_name_from_uri(nm, topo);
00722     res |= ccn_charbuf_append_charbuf(cb, nm);
00723     res |= ccn_name_from_uri(nm, prefix);
00724     res |= ccn_charbuf_append_charbuf(cb, nm);
00725     res |= ccnb_element_begin(cb, CCN_DTAG_SyncConfigSliceList);
00726     for (i = 0; i < count ; i++) {
00727         res |= SyncAppendTaggedNumber(cb, CCN_DTAG_SyncConfigSliceOp, 0);
00728         res |= ccn_name_from_uri(nm, clauses[i]);
00729         res |= ccn_charbuf_append_charbuf(cb, nm);
00730     }
00731     res |= ccnb_element_end(cb);
00732     res |= ccnb_element_end(cb);
00733     
00734     if (res >= 0) {
00735         // now we have the encoding, so make the hash
00736         struct ccn *ccn = NULL;
00737         struct ccn_digest *cow = ccn_digest_create(CCN_DIGEST_DEFAULT);
00738         size_t sz = ccn_digest_size(cow);
00739         unsigned char *dst = ccn_charbuf_reserve(hash, sz);
00740         ccn_digest_init(cow);
00741         ccn_digest_update(cow, cb->buf, cb->length);
00742         ccn_digest_final(cow, dst, sz);
00743         hash->length = sz;
00744         ccn_digest_destroy(&cow);
00745         
00746         // form the Sync protocol name
00747         static char *localLit = "\xC1.M.S.localhost";
00748         static char *sliceCmd = "\xC1.S.cs";
00749         res |= ccn_name_init(nm);
00750         res |= ccn_name_append_str(nm, localLit);
00751         res |= ccn_name_append_str(nm, sliceCmd);
00752         res |= ccn_name_append(nm, hash->buf, hash->length);
00753         
00754         if (parms->noSend) {
00755             // don't send the slice, just print the hash as a URI
00756             struct ccn_charbuf *hName = ccn_charbuf_create();
00757             ccn_name_init(hName);
00758             ccn_name_append(hName, hash->buf, hash->length);
00759             struct ccn_charbuf *uri = SyncUriForName(hName);
00760             fprintf(stdout, "%s\n", ccn_charbuf_as_string(uri));
00761             ccn_charbuf_destroy(&hName);
00762             ccn_charbuf_destroy(&uri);
00763             return 0;
00764         }
00765         
00766         ccn = ccn_create();
00767         if (ccn_connect(ccn, NULL) == -1) {
00768             perror("Could not connect to ccnd");
00769             exit(1);
00770         }
00771         if (res >= 0) res |= localStore(parms, ccn, nm, cb);
00772         if (res < 0) {
00773             res = noteErr("sendSlice, failed");
00774         } else {
00775             if (parms->mode != 0) {
00776                 struct ccn_charbuf *uri = SyncUriForName(nm);
00777                 if (parms->mark) putMark(stdout);
00778                 fprintf(stdout, "sendSlice, sent %s\n",
00779                         ccn_charbuf_as_string(uri));
00780                 ccn_charbuf_destroy(&uri);
00781             }
00782         }
00783         
00784         ccn_destroy(&ccn);
00785     }
00786     
00787     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&cb);
00788     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&hash);
00789     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&nm);
00790     if (res > 0) res = 0;
00791     return res;
00792 }
00793 
00794 struct storeFileStruct {
00795     struct SyncTestParms *parms;
00796     struct ccn_charbuf *nm;
00797     struct ccn_charbuf *cb;
00798     struct ccn *ccn;
00799     off_t bs;
00800     off_t fSize;
00801     FILE *file;
00802     unsigned char *segData;
00803     int nSegs;
00804     int stored;
00805     struct ccn_charbuf *template;
00806 };
00807 
00808 static int64_t
00809 segFromInfo(struct ccn_upcall_info *info) {
00810         // gets the current segment number for the info
00811         // returns -1 if not known
00812         if (info == NULL) return -1;
00813         const unsigned char *ccnb = info->content_ccnb;
00814         struct ccn_indexbuf *cc = info->content_comps;
00815         if (cc == NULL || ccnb == NULL) {
00816                 // go back to the interest
00817                 cc = info->interest_comps;
00818                 ccnb = info->interest_ccnb;
00819                 if (cc == NULL || ccnb == NULL) return -1;
00820         }
00821         int ns = cc->n;
00822         if (ns > 2) {
00823                 // assume that the segment number is the last component
00824                 int start = cc->buf[ns - 2];
00825                 int stop = cc->buf[ns - 1];
00826                 if (start < stop) {
00827                         size_t len = 0;
00828                         const unsigned char *data = NULL;
00829                         ccn_ref_tagged_BLOB(CCN_DTAG_Component, ccnb, start, stop, &data, &len);
00830                         if (len > 0 && data != NULL) {
00831                                 // parse big-endian encoded number
00832                                 // TBD: where is this in the library?
00833                                 if (data[0] == CCN_MARKER_SEQNUM) {
00834                     int64_t n = 0;
00835                     int i = 0;
00836                     for (i = 1; i < len; i++) {
00837                         n = n * 256 + data[i];
00838                     }
00839                     return n;
00840                 }
00841                         }
00842                 }
00843         }
00844         return -1;
00845 }
00846 
00847 static enum ccn_upcall_res
00848 storeHandler(struct ccn_closure *selfp,
00849              enum ccn_upcall_kind kind,
00850              struct ccn_upcall_info *info) {
00851     struct storeFileStruct *sfd = selfp->data;
00852     enum ccn_upcall_res ret = CCN_UPCALL_RESULT_OK;
00853     switch (kind) {
00854         case CCN_UPCALL_FINAL:
00855         free(selfp);
00856         break;
00857         case CCN_UPCALL_INTEREST: {
00858             int64_t seg = segFromInfo(info);
00859             if (seg < 0) seg = 0;
00860             struct ccn_charbuf *uri = ccn_charbuf_create();
00861             ccn_uri_append(uri, sfd->nm->buf, sfd->nm->length, 0);
00862             char *str = ccn_charbuf_as_string(uri);
00863             ret = CCN_UPCALL_RESULT_INTEREST_CONSUMED;
00864             if (seg >= 0 && seg < sfd->nSegs) {
00865                 struct ccn_charbuf *name = SyncCopyName(sfd->nm);
00866                 struct ccn_charbuf *cb = ccn_charbuf_create();
00867                 struct ccn_charbuf *cob = ccn_charbuf_create();
00868                 off_t bs = sfd->bs;
00869                 off_t pos = seg * bs;
00870                 off_t rs = sfd->fSize - pos;
00871                 if (rs > bs) rs = bs;
00872                 
00873                 ccn_charbuf_reserve(cb, rs);
00874                 cb->length = rs;
00875                 char *cp = ccn_charbuf_as_string(cb);
00876                 
00877                 // fill in the contents
00878                 int res = fseeko(sfd->file, pos, SEEK_SET);
00879                 if (res >= 0) {
00880                     res = fread(cp, rs, 1, sfd->file);
00881                     if (res < 0) {
00882                         char *eMess = strerror(errno);
00883                         fprintf(stderr, "ERROR in fread, %s, seg %d, %s\n",
00884                                 eMess, (int) seg, str);
00885                     }
00886                 } else {
00887                     char *eMess = strerror(errno);
00888                     fprintf(stderr, "ERROR in fseeko, %s, seg %d, %s\n",
00889                             eMess, (int) seg, str);
00890                 }
00891                 
00892                 if (res >= 0) {
00893                     struct ccn_signing_params sp = CCN_SIGNING_PARAMS_INIT;
00894                     const void *cp = NULL;
00895                     size_t cs = 0;
00896                     sp.type = CCN_CONTENT_DATA;
00897                     cp = (const void *) cb->buf;
00898                     cs = cb->length;
00899                     sp.template_ccnb = sfd->template;
00900                     
00901                     if (seg+1 == sfd->nSegs) sp.sp_flags |= CCN_SP_FINAL_BLOCK;
00902                     ccn_name_append_numeric(name, CCN_MARKER_SEQNUM, seg);
00903                     res |= ccn_sign_content(sfd->ccn,
00904                                             cob,
00905                                             name,
00906                                             &sp,
00907                                             cp,
00908                                             rs);
00909                     if (sfd->parms->digest) {
00910                         // not sure if this generates the right hash
00911                         struct ccn_parsed_ContentObject pcos;
00912                         ccn_parse_ContentObject(cob->buf, cob->length,
00913                                                 &pcos, NULL);
00914                         ccn_digest_ContentObject(cob->buf, &pcos);
00915                         if (pcos.digest_bytes > 0)
00916                             res |= ccn_name_append(name, pcos.digest, pcos.digest_bytes);
00917                     }
00918                     res |= ccn_put(sfd->ccn, (const void *) cob->buf, cob->length);
00919                     
00920                     if (res < 0) {
00921                         return noteErr("seg %d, %s",
00922                                        (int) seg,
00923                                        str);
00924                     } else if (sfd->parms->verbose) {
00925                         if (sfd->parms->mark) putMark(stdout);
00926                         struct ccn_charbuf *nameUri = ccn_charbuf_create();
00927                         ccn_uri_append(nameUri, name->buf, name->length, 0);
00928                         char *nameStr = ccn_charbuf_as_string(nameUri);
00929                         fprintf(stdout, "put seg %d, %s\n",
00930                                 (int) seg,
00931                                 nameStr);
00932                         ccn_charbuf_destroy(&nameUri);
00933                     }
00934                     
00935                     // update the tracking
00936                     unsigned char uc = sfd->segData[seg];
00937                     if (uc == 0) {
00938                         uc++;
00939                         sfd->stored++;
00940                     } else {
00941                         if (sfd->parms->noDup) {
00942                             fprintf(stderr,
00943                                     "ERROR in storeHandler, duplicate segment request, seg %d, %s\n",
00944                                     (int) seg, str);
00945                         }
00946                         if (uc < 255) uc++;
00947                     }
00948                     sfd->segData[seg] = uc;
00949                 }
00950                 
00951                 ccn_charbuf_destroy(&name);
00952                 ccn_charbuf_destroy(&cb);
00953                 ccn_charbuf_destroy(&cob);
00954                 
00955             }
00956             ccn_charbuf_destroy(&uri);
00957             break;
00958         }
00959         default:
00960         ret = CCN_UPCALL_RESULT_ERR;
00961         break;
00962     }
00963     return ret;
00964 }
00965 
00966 static void
00967 formatStats(struct SyncTestParms *parms) {
00968     int64_t dt = (1000000*(parms->stopTime.tv_sec-parms->startTime.tv_sec)
00969                   + parms->stopTime.tv_usec-parms->startTime.tv_usec);
00970     if (dt <= 0) dt = 1;
00971     int64_t rate = 0;
00972     
00973     switch (parms->mode) {
00974         case 0: {
00975             // silent
00976             break;
00977         }
00978         case 3: {
00979             // catchunks2 compatible
00980             const char *expid = getenv("CCN_EXPERIMENT_ID");
00981             const char *sep = " ";
00982             if (expid == NULL) {
00983                 expid = "";
00984                 sep = "";
00985             }
00986             rate = (parms->fSize * 1000000) / dt;
00987             if (parms->mark) putMark(stderr);
00988             fprintf(stderr,
00989                     "%ld.%06u SyncTest[%d]: %s%s"
00990                     "%jd bytes transferred in %ld.%06u seconds (%ld bytes/sec)"
00991                     "\n",
00992                     (long) parms->stopTime.tv_sec,
00993                     (unsigned) parms->stopTime.tv_usec,
00994                     (int)getpid(),
00995                     expid,
00996                     sep,
00997                     (intmax_t) parms->fSize,
00998                     (long) (dt / 1000000),
00999                     (unsigned) (dt % 1000000),
01000                     (long) rate
01001                     );
01002             break;
01003         }
01004         default: {
01005             // brief mode
01006             dt = (dt + 500) / 1000;
01007             if (dt <= 0) dt = 1;
01008             rate = parms->fSize / dt;
01009             
01010             if (parms->mark) putMark(stdout);
01011             fprintf(stdout, "transferred %jd bytes in %d.%03d seconds = %d.%03d MB/sec\n",
01012                     (intmax_t) parms->fSize,
01013                     (int) (dt / 1000), (int) dt % 1000,
01014                     (int) (rate / 1000), (int) rate % 1000);
01015             break;
01016         }
01017         
01018     }
01019 }
01020 
01021 static int
01022 getFile(struct SyncTestParms *parms, char *src, char *dst) {
01023     // gets the file, stores it to stdout
01024     
01025     FILE *file = NULL;
01026     
01027     if (dst != NULL) {
01028         file = fopen(dst, "w");
01029         if (file == NULL) {
01030             perror("fopen failed");
01031             return -1;
01032         }
01033     }
01034     
01035     struct ccn *ccn = NULL;
01036     ccn = ccn_create();
01037     // special case to remove verification overhead
01038     if (dst == NULL)
01039     ccn_defer_verification(ccn, 1);
01040     if (ccn_connect(ccn, NULL) == -1) {
01041         perror("Could not connect to ccnd");
01042         return -1;
01043     }
01044     struct ccn_charbuf *cb = ccn_charbuf_create();
01045     struct ccn_charbuf *nm = ccn_charbuf_create();
01046     int bs = parms->blockSize;
01047     
01048     int res = ccn_name_from_uri(nm, src);
01049     if (res < 0) {
01050         perror("ccn_name_from_uri failed");
01051         return -1;
01052     }
01053     
01054     if (parms->resolve) {
01055         res = ccn_resolve_version(ccn, nm, CCN_V_HIGH, parms->life*1000);
01056         // TBD: use parms to determine versioning_flags and timeout_ms?
01057         if (res < 0) {
01058             perror("ccn_resolve_version failed");
01059             return -1;
01060         }
01061     }
01062     
01063     struct ccn_fetch *cf = ccn_fetch_new(ccn);
01064     struct ccn_charbuf *template = SyncGenInterest(NULL,
01065                                                    parms->scope,
01066                                                    parms->life,
01067                                                    -1, -1, NULL);
01068     
01069     if (parms->verbose) {
01070         ccn_fetch_set_debug(cf, stderr,
01071                             ccn_fetch_flags_NoteOpenClose
01072                             | ccn_fetch_flags_NoteNeed
01073                             | ccn_fetch_flags_NoteFill
01074                             | ccn_fetch_flags_NoteTimeout
01075                             | ccn_fetch_flags_NoteFinal);
01076     }
01077     gettimeofday(&parms->startTime, 0);
01078     
01079     if (parms->segmented == 0) {
01080         // no segments, so use a single get
01081         struct ccn_parsed_ContentObject pcos;
01082         res = ccn_get(ccn, nm, template,
01083                       parms->life*1000,
01084                       cb, &pcos, NULL, 0);
01085         ccn_charbuf_destroy(&template);
01086         if (res < 0) {
01087             perror("get failed");
01088             return -1;
01089         }
01090         if (file != NULL) {
01091             size_t nItems = fwrite(ccn_charbuf_as_string(cb), cb->length, 1, file);
01092             if (nItems < 1) {
01093                 perror("fwrite failed");
01094                 return -1;
01095             }
01096         }
01097         parms->fSize = parms->fSize + cb->length;
01098         
01099     } else {
01100         // segmented, so use fetch.h
01101         struct ccn_fetch_stream *fs = ccn_fetch_open(cf, nm,
01102                                                      "SyncTest",
01103                                                      template,
01104                                                      parms->bufs,
01105                                                      0, 0);
01106         ccn_charbuf_destroy(&template);
01107         if (fs == NULL) {
01108             perror("ccn_fetch_open failed");
01109             return -1;
01110         }
01111         ccn_charbuf_reserve(cb, bs);
01112         cb->length = bs;
01113         char *cp = ccn_charbuf_as_string(cb);
01114         
01115         for (;;) {
01116             intmax_t av = ccn_fetch_avail(fs);
01117             if (av == CCN_FETCH_READ_NONE) {
01118                 res = ccn_run(ccn, 1);
01119                 if (res < 0) {
01120                     perror("ccn_run failed");
01121                     return -1;
01122                 }
01123                 continue;
01124             }
01125             int nb = ccn_fetch_read(fs, cp, bs);
01126             if (nb > 0) {
01127                 if (file != NULL) {
01128                     size_t nItems = fwrite(cp, nb, 1, file);
01129                     if (nItems < 1) {
01130                         perror("fwrite failed");
01131                         exit(1);
01132                     }
01133                 }
01134                 parms->fSize = parms->fSize + nb;
01135             } else if (nb == CCN_FETCH_READ_NONE) {
01136                 // try again
01137                 res = ccn_run(ccn, 1);
01138                 if (res < 0) {
01139                     perror("ccn_run failed");
01140                     return -1;
01141                 }                
01142             } else {
01143                 if (nb == CCN_FETCH_READ_END) break;
01144                 if (nb == CCN_FETCH_READ_TIMEOUT) {
01145                     perror("read failed, timeout");
01146                     exit(1);
01147                 }
01148                 char temp[256];
01149                 snprintf(temp, sizeof(temp), "ccn_fetch_read failed: %d", nb);
01150                 perror(temp);
01151                 return -1;
01152             }
01153         }
01154         ccn_fetch_close(fs);
01155     }
01156     
01157     gettimeofday(&parms->stopTime, 0);
01158     
01159     if (file != NULL)
01160     fclose(file);
01161     
01162     ccn_fetch_destroy(cf);
01163     
01164     ccn_destroy(&ccn);
01165     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&cb);
01166     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&nm);
01167     
01168     formatStats(parms);
01169     
01170     if (res > 0) res = 0;
01171     return res;
01172 }
01173 
01174 static int
01175 putFile(struct SyncTestParms *parms, char *src, char *dst) {
01176     // stores the src file to the dst file (in the repo)
01177     
01178     struct stat myStat;
01179     int res = stat(src, &myStat);
01180     if (res < 0) {
01181         perror("putFile, stat failed");
01182         return -1;
01183     }
01184     off_t fSize = myStat.st_size;
01185     
01186     if (fSize == 0) {
01187         return noteErr("putFile, stat failed, empty src");
01188     }
01189     FILE *file = fopen(src, "r");
01190     if (file == NULL) {
01191         perror("putFile, fopen failed");
01192         return -1;
01193     }
01194     
01195     struct ccn *ccn = NULL;
01196     ccn = ccn_create();
01197     if (ccn_connect(ccn, NULL) == -1) {
01198         return noteErr("putFile, could not connect to ccnd");
01199     }
01200     struct ccn_charbuf *cb = ccn_charbuf_create();
01201     struct ccn_charbuf *nm = ccn_charbuf_create();
01202     struct ccn_charbuf *cmd = ccn_charbuf_create();
01203     int bs = parms->blockSize;
01204     
01205     res = ccn_name_from_uri(nm, dst);
01206     if (res < 0) {
01207         return noteErr("putFile, ccn_name_from_uri failed");
01208     }
01209     ccn_create_version(ccn, nm, CCN_V_NOW, 0, 0);
01210     
01211     struct storeFileStruct *sfData = NEW_STRUCT(1, storeFileStruct);
01212     sfData->parms = parms;
01213     sfData->file = file;
01214     sfData->bs = bs;
01215     sfData->nm = nm;
01216     sfData->cb = cb;
01217     sfData->ccn = ccn;
01218     sfData->fSize = fSize;
01219     sfData->nSegs = (fSize + bs -1) / bs;
01220     sfData->segData = NEW_ANY(sfData->nSegs, unsigned char);
01221     
01222     {
01223         // make a template to govern the timestamp for the segments
01224         // this allows duplicate segment requests to return the same hash
01225         const unsigned char *vp = NULL;
01226         ssize_t vs;
01227         SyncGetComponentPtr(nm, SyncComponentCount(nm)-1, &vp, &vs);
01228         if (vp != NULL && vs > 0) {
01229             sfData->template = ccn_charbuf_create();
01230             ccnb_element_begin(sfData->template, CCN_DTAG_SignedInfo);
01231             ccnb_append_tagged_blob(sfData->template, CCN_DTAG_Timestamp, vp, vs);
01232             ccnb_element_end(sfData->template);
01233         } else return noteErr("putFile, create store template failed");
01234     }
01235     
01236     struct ccn_charbuf *template = SyncGenInterest(NULL,
01237                                                    parms->scope,
01238                                                    parms->life,
01239                                                    -1, -1, NULL);
01240     struct ccn_closure *action = NEW_STRUCT(1, ccn_closure);
01241     action->p = storeHandler;
01242     action->data = sfData;
01243     
01244     parms->fSize = fSize;
01245     
01246     // fire off a listener
01247     res = ccn_set_interest_filter(ccn, nm, action);
01248     if (res < 0) {
01249         return noteErr("putFile, ccn_set_interest_filter failed");
01250     }
01251     res = ccn_run(ccn, 40);
01252     if (res < 0) {
01253         return noteErr("putFile, ccn_run failed");
01254     }
01255     // initiate the write
01256     // construct the store request and "send" it as an interest
01257     ccn_charbuf_append_charbuf(cmd, nm);
01258     ccn_name_from_uri(cmd, "%C1.R.sw");
01259     ccn_name_append_nonce(cmd);
01260     
01261     if (parms->verbose && parms->mode != 0) {
01262         struct ccn_charbuf *uri = SyncUriForName(nm);
01263         if (parms->mark) putMark(stdout);
01264         fprintf(stdout, "put init, %s\n",
01265                 ccn_charbuf_as_string(uri));
01266         ccn_charbuf_destroy(&uri);
01267     }
01268     gettimeofday(&parms->startTime, 0);
01269     ccn_get(ccn, cmd, template, DEFAULT_CMD_TIMEOUT, NULL, NULL, NULL, 0);
01270     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&template);
01271     if (res < 0) {
01272         return noteErr("putFile, ccn_get failed");
01273     }
01274     
01275     // wait for completion
01276     res = 0;
01277     while (res == 0 && sfData->stored < sfData->nSegs) {
01278         res = ccn_run(ccn, 2);
01279     }
01280     if (res < 0) {
01281         return noteErr("putFile, ccn_run failed while storing");
01282     }
01283     
01284     gettimeofday(&parms->stopTime, 0);
01285     
01286     res = ccn_set_interest_filter(ccn, nm, NULL);
01287     if (res < 0) {
01288         return noteErr("putFile, ccn_set_interest_filter failed (removal)");
01289     }
01290     res = ccn_run(ccn, 40);
01291     if (res < 0) {
01292         return noteErr("putFile, ccn_run failed");
01293     }
01294     
01295     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&sfData->template);
01296     free(sfData->segData);
01297     free(sfData);
01298     ccn_destroy(&ccn);
01299     fclose(file);
01300     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&cb);
01301     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&cmd);
01302     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&nm);
01303     
01304     formatStats(parms);
01305     
01306     if (res > 0) res = 0;
01307     return res;
01308 }
01309 
01310 extern int
01311 appendComponents(struct ccn_charbuf *dst,
01312                  const struct ccn_charbuf *src,
01313                  int start, int len) {
01314     struct ccn_buf_decoder sbd;
01315     struct ccn_buf_decoder *s = SyncInitDecoderFromCharbuf(&sbd, src, 0);
01316     int count = 0;
01317     int pos = 0;
01318     if (!ccn_buf_match_dtag(s, CCN_DTAG_Name))
01319         // src is not a name
01320         return -__LINE__;
01321     ccn_buf_advance(s);
01322     int lim = start + len;
01323     while (count < lim) {
01324         if (!ccn_buf_match_dtag(s, CCN_DTAG_Component)) {
01325             ccn_buf_check_close(s);
01326             if (SyncCheckDecodeErr(s)) return -__LINE__;
01327             break;
01328         }
01329         ccn_buf_advance(s);
01330         const unsigned char *cPtr = NULL;
01331         size_t cSize = 0;
01332         if (ccn_buf_match_blob(s, &cPtr, &cSize)) ccn_buf_advance(s);
01333         if (cPtr == NULL)
01334             return -__LINE__;
01335         if (count >= start) {
01336             if (ccn_name_append(dst, cPtr, cSize) < 0)
01337                 return -__LINE__;
01338         }
01339         count++;
01340         ccn_buf_check_close(s);
01341         if (SyncCheckDecodeErr(s)) return -__LINE__;
01342         pos++;
01343     }
01344     return count;
01345 }
01346 
01347 static int
01348 putFileList(struct SyncTestParms *parms, char *listName) {
01349     struct ccn *ccn = NULL;
01350     ccn = ccn_create();
01351     if (ccn_connect(ccn, NULL) == -1) {
01352         return noteErr("putFile, could not connect to ccnd");
01353     }
01354     FILE *listFile = fopen(listName, "r");
01355     if (listFile == NULL) {
01356         return noteErr("putFileList, failed to open list file");
01357     }
01358     int ret = 0;
01359     struct SyncNameAccum *na = readAndAccumNames(listFile, MAX_READ_LEN);
01360     int i = 0;
01361     fclose(listFile);
01362     struct ccn_charbuf *tmp = ccn_charbuf_create();
01363     struct ccn_charbuf *template = SyncGenInterest(NULL,
01364                                                    parms->scope,
01365                                                    parms->life,
01366                                                    -1, -1, NULL);
01367     while (i < na->len) {
01368         tmp->length = 0;
01369         ccn_name_init(tmp);
01370         struct ccn_charbuf *each = na->ents[i].name;
01371         int nc = SyncComponentCount(each);
01372         if (parms->verbose) {
01373             struct ccn_charbuf *uri = SyncUriForName(each);
01374             if (parms->mark) putMark(stdout);
01375             fprintf(stdout, "putFileList %d, %s\n",
01376                     i, ccn_charbuf_as_string(uri));
01377             fflush(stdout);
01378             ccn_charbuf_destroy(&uri);
01379         }
01380         if (nc < 3) {
01381             ret = noteErr("putFileList, bad name");
01382             break;
01383         }
01384         const unsigned char *xp = NULL;
01385         ssize_t xs = -1;
01386         SyncGetComponentPtr(each, nc-2, &xp, &xs);
01387         if (xs > 0 && xp[0] == '\000') {
01388             // segment info, so split the name
01389             ret |= appendComponents(tmp, each, 0, nc-2);
01390             ret |= ccn_name_append_str(tmp, "\xC1.R.sw-c");
01391             ret |= ccn_name_append_nonce(tmp);
01392             ret |= appendComponents(tmp, each, nc-2, 2);
01393         } else {
01394             // no segment, so use the whole name
01395             ret |= appendComponents(tmp, each, 0, nc);
01396             ret |= ccn_name_append_str(tmp, "\xC1.R.sw-c");
01397             ret |= ccn_name_append_nonce(tmp);
01398         }
01399         
01400         if (ret < 0) {
01401             ret = noteErr("putFileList, bad name");
01402             break;
01403         }
01404         ccn_get(ccn, tmp, template, DEFAULT_CMD_TIMEOUT, NULL, NULL, NULL, 0);
01405         ret = ccn_run(ccn, 10);
01406         if (ret < 0) {
01407             ret = noteErr("putFileList, ccn_run failed");
01408             break;
01409         }
01410         i++;
01411     }
01412     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&template);
01413     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&tmp);
01414     na = SyncFreeNameAccumAndNames(na);
01415     ccn_destroy(&ccn);
01416     return ret;
01417 }
01418 
01419 static int
01420 existingRootOp(struct SyncTestParms *parms,
01421                char *topo, char *prefix,
01422                int delete) {
01423     // constructs a simple config slice and sends it to an attached repo
01424     // now we have the encoding, so make the hash
01425     struct ccn *ccn = NULL;
01426     int res = 0;
01427     
01428     ccn = ccn_create();
01429     if (ccn_connect(ccn, NULL) == -1) {
01430         perror("Could not connect to ccnd");
01431         exit(1);
01432     }
01433     
01434     // form the Sync protocol name
01435     static char *cmdLit = "\xC1.S.rs";
01436     struct ccn_charbuf *nm = ccn_charbuf_create();
01437     if (delete) cmdLit = "\xC1.S.cs";
01438     
01439     res |= ccn_name_init(nm);
01440     res |= ccn_name_from_uri(nm, topo);
01441     if (prefix != NULL) {
01442         struct ccn_charbuf *pre = ccn_charbuf_create();
01443         res |= ccn_name_from_uri(pre, prefix);
01444         res |= ccn_name_append_str(nm, cmdLit);
01445         res |= SyncAppendAllComponents(nm, pre);
01446         ccn_charbuf_destroy(&pre);
01447     }
01448     
01449     struct ccn_charbuf *cb = ccn_charbuf_create();
01450     if (delete) {
01451         // requesting deletion
01452         res |= localStore(parms, ccn, nm, NULL);
01453         if (res < 0) {
01454             res = noteErr("requestDelete, failed");
01455         } else {
01456             // claimed success 
01457             struct ccn_charbuf *uri = SyncUriForName(nm);
01458             if (parms->mark) putMark(stdout);
01459             fprintf(stdout, "requestDelete, sent %s\n",
01460                     ccn_charbuf_as_string(uri));
01461             ccn_charbuf_destroy(&uri);
01462         }
01463     } else {
01464         // requesting stats
01465         struct ccn_charbuf *tmpl = SyncGenInterest(NULL, 1, 2, -1, 1, NULL);
01466         res |= ccn_get(ccn, nm, tmpl, DEFAULT_CMD_TIMEOUT, cb, NULL, NULL, 0);
01467         
01468         const unsigned char *xp = NULL;
01469         size_t xs = 0;
01470         if (res < 0) {
01471             res = noteErr("requestStats, ccn_get failed");
01472         } else {
01473             res |= SyncPointerToContent(cb, NULL, &xp, &xs);
01474             
01475             if (res < 0 || xs == 0) {
01476                 res = noteErr("requestStats, failed");
01477             } else {
01478                 if (parms->mark) putMark(stdout);
01479                 fwrite(xp, xs, sizeof(char), stdout);
01480                 fprintf(stdout, "\n");
01481             }
01482         }
01483         ccn_charbuf_destroy(&tmpl);
01484     }
01485     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&cb);
01486     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&nm);
01487     ccn_destroy(&ccn);
01488     if (res > 0) res = 0;
01489     return res;
01490 }
01491 
01492 static void
01493 my_r_sync_msg(struct sync_plumbing *sd, const char *fmt, ...) {
01494     if (sd != NULL && fmt != NULL) {
01495         va_list ap;
01496         va_start(ap, fmt);
01497         vfprintf(stdout, fmt, ap);
01498         va_end(ap);
01499     }
01500 }
01501 
01502 struct sync_plumbing_client_methods client_methods = {
01503     &my_r_sync_msg,
01504     NULL,
01505     NULL,
01506     NULL,
01507     NULL
01508 };
01509 
01510 static void
01511 SyncFreeBase(struct SyncBaseStruct *base) {
01512     struct sync_plumbing *sd = base->sd;
01513     struct ccn_charbuf *state_buf = ccn_charbuf_create();
01514     sd->sync_methods->sync_stop(sd, state_buf);
01515     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&state_buf);
01516 }
01517 
01518 // TBD: make this NOT cloned, but also not taken from ccnr!
01519 int
01520 ccnr_msg_level_from_string(const char *s)
01521 {
01522     long v;
01523     char *ep;
01524     
01525     if (s == NULL || s[0] == 0)
01526         return(1);
01527     if (0 == strcasecmp(s, "NONE"))
01528         return(CCNL_NONE);
01529     if (0 == strcasecmp(s, "SEVERE"))
01530         return(CCNL_SEVERE);
01531     if (0 == strcasecmp(s, "ERROR"))
01532         return(CCNL_ERROR);
01533     if (0 == strcasecmp(s, "WARNING"))
01534         return(CCNL_WARNING);
01535     if (0 == strcasecmp(s, "INFO"))
01536         return(CCNL_INFO);
01537     if (0 == strcasecmp(s, "FINE"))
01538         return(CCNL_FINE);
01539     if (0 == strcasecmp(s, "FINER"))
01540         return(CCNL_FINER);
01541     if (0 == strcasecmp(s, "FINEST"))
01542         return(CCNL_FINEST);
01543     v = strtol(s, &ep, 10);
01544     if (v > CCNL_FINEST || v < 0 || ep[0] != 0)
01545         return(-1);
01546     return(v);
01547 }
01548 
01549 int
01550 main(int argc, char **argv) {
01551     int i = 1;
01552     int seen = 0;
01553     int res = 0;
01554     struct sync_plumbing sdStruct;
01555     struct sync_plumbing *sd = &sdStruct;
01556     struct SyncTestParms parmStore;
01557     struct SyncTestParms *parms = &parmStore;
01558     
01559     sd->client_methods = &client_methods;
01560     struct SyncBaseStruct *base = SyncNewBase(sd);
01561     
01562     memset(parms, 0, sizeof(parmStore));
01563     
01564     parms->mode = 1;
01565     parms->scope = 1;
01566     parms->syncScope = 2;
01567     parms->life = 4;
01568     parms->bufs = 4;
01569     parms->blockSize = 4096;
01570     parms->base = base;
01571     parms->resolve = 1;
01572     parms->segmented = 1;
01573     
01574     while (i < argc && res >= 0) {
01575         char * sw = argv[i];
01576         i++;
01577         char *arg1 = NULL;
01578         char *arg2 = NULL;
01579         if (i < argc) arg1 = argv[i];
01580         if (i+1 < argc) arg2 = argv[i+1];
01581         if (strcasecmp(sw, "-debug") == 0 || strcasecmp(sw, "-d") == 0) {
01582             i++;
01583             base->debug = ccnr_msg_level_from_string(arg1);
01584             if (base->debug < 0) {
01585                 res = noteErr("invalid debug level %s", arg1);
01586             }
01587         } else if (strcasecmp(sw, "-v") == 0) {
01588             parms->verbose = 1;
01589         } else if (strcasecmp(sw, "-cat2") == 0) {
01590             parms->mode = 3;
01591         } else if (strcasecmp(sw, "-mark") == 0) {
01592             parms->mark = 1;
01593         } else if (strcasecmp(sw, "-digest") == 0) {
01594             parms->digest = 1;
01595         } else if (strcasecmp(sw, "-null") == 0) {
01596             parms->mode = 0;
01597         } else if (strcasecmp(sw, "-binary") == 0) {
01598             parms->mode = 1;
01599         } else if (strcasecmp(sw, "-ccnb") == 0) {
01600             parms->mode = 1;
01601         } else if (strcasecmp(sw, "-text") == 0) {
01602             parms->mode = 2;
01603         } else if (strcasecmp(sw, "-nodup") == 0) {
01604             parms->noDup = 1;
01605         } else if (strcasecmp(sw, "-nores") == 0) {
01606             parms->resolve = 0;
01607         } else if (strcasecmp(sw, "-noseg") == 0) {
01608             parms->segmented = 0;
01609         } else if (strcasecmp(sw, "-nosend") == 0) {
01610             parms->noSend = 1;
01611         } else if (strcasecmp(sw, "-bs") == 0) {
01612             i++;
01613             if (arg1 != NULL) {
01614                 int bs = atoi(arg1);
01615                 if (bs <= 0 || bs > 64*1024) {
01616                     res = noteErr("invalid block size %s", arg1);
01617                 }
01618                 parms->blockSize = bs;
01619             } else
01620             res = noteErr("missing block size");
01621             seen++;
01622         } else if (strcasecmp(sw, "-bufs") == 0) {
01623             if (arg1 != NULL) {
01624                 i++;
01625                 int bufs = atoi(arg1);
01626                 if (bufs <= 0 || bufs > 1024) {
01627                     res = noteErr("invalid number of buffers %s", arg1);
01628                     break;
01629                 }
01630                 parms->bufs = bufs;
01631             } else 
01632             res = noteErr("missing number of buffers");
01633         } else if (strcasecmp(sw, "-scope") == 0) {
01634             if (arg1 != NULL) {
01635                 int scope = atoi(arg1);
01636                 if (scope < -1 || scope > 2) {
01637                     res = noteErr("invalid scope %s", arg1);
01638                     break;
01639                 }
01640                 parms->scope = scope;
01641                 i++;
01642             } else
01643                 res = noteErr("missing scope");
01644             seen++;
01645         } else if (strcasecmp(sw, "-syncScope") == 0) {
01646             if (arg1 != NULL) {
01647                 int scope = atoi(arg1);
01648                 if (scope < -1 || scope > 2) {
01649                     res = noteErr("invalid scope %s", arg1);
01650                     break;
01651                 }
01652                 parms->syncScope = scope;
01653                 i++;
01654             } else
01655                 res = noteErr("missing scope");
01656             seen++;
01657         } else if (strcasecmp(sw, "-life") == 0) {
01658             if (arg1 != NULL) {
01659                 int life = atoi(arg1);
01660                 if (life < -1 || life > 30) {
01661                     res = noteErr("invalid interest lifetime %s", arg1);
01662                     break;
01663                 }
01664                 parms->life = life;
01665                 i++;
01666             } else
01667             res = noteErr("missing interest lifetime");
01668             seen++;
01669         } else if (strcasecmp(sw, "-basic") == 0) {
01670             res = testRootBasic(parms);
01671             seen++;
01672         } else if (strcasecmp(sw, "-target") == 0) {
01673             if (arg1 != NULL) {
01674                 parms->target = arg1;
01675                 i++;
01676             } else
01677             res = noteErr("missing target");
01678             seen++;
01679         } else if (strcasecmp(sw, "-build") == 0) {
01680             if (arg1 != NULL) {
01681                 i++;
01682                 parms->inputName = arg1;
01683                 res = testReadBuilder(parms);
01684             } else
01685             res = noteErr("missing file name");
01686             seen++;
01687         } else if (strcasecmp(sw, "-read") == 0) {
01688             if (arg1 != NULL) {
01689                 i++;
01690                 parms->inputName = arg1;
01691                 parms->sort = 0;
01692                 res = testReader(parms);
01693             } else
01694             res = noteErr("missing file name");
01695             seen++;
01696         } else if (strcasecmp(sw, "-sort") == 0) {
01697             if (arg1 != NULL) {
01698                 i++;
01699                 parms->inputName = arg1;
01700                 parms->sort = 1;
01701                 res = testReader(parms);
01702             } else
01703             res = noteErr("missing file name");
01704             seen++;
01705         } else if (strcasecmp(sw, "-abs") == 0) {
01706             if (arg1 != NULL) {
01707                 i++;
01708                 parms->inputName = arg1;
01709                 parms->sort = 2;
01710                 res = testReader(parms);
01711             } else
01712             res = noteErr("missing file name");
01713             seen++;
01714         } else if (strcasecmp(sw, "-splits") == 0) {
01715             int n = 0;
01716             while (i >= argc) {
01717                 char *x = argv[i];
01718                 char c = x[0];
01719                 if (c < '0' || c > '9') break;
01720                 n++;
01721                 i++;
01722             }
01723             parms->nSplits = n;
01724             if (parms->splits != NULL) free(parms->splits);
01725             parms->splits = NULL;
01726             if (n > 0) {
01727                 int j = 0;
01728                 parms->splits = NEW_ANY(n, int);
01729                 i = i - n;
01730                 while (j < n) {
01731                     parms->splits[j] = atoi(argv[i]);
01732                     i++;
01733                     j++;
01734                 }
01735             }
01736             seen++;
01737         } else if (strcasecmp(sw, "-encode") == 0) {
01738             res = testEncodeDecode(parms);
01739             seen++;
01740         } else if (strcasecmp(sw, "-slice") == 0) {
01741             char **clauses = NEW_ANY(argc, char *);
01742             int count = 0;
01743             if (arg1 != NULL && arg2 != NULL) {
01744                 i++;
01745                 i++;
01746                 while (i < argc) {
01747                     char *clause = argv[i];
01748                     if (clause[0] == '-' || clause[0] == 0) break;
01749                     i++;
01750                     clauses[count] = clause;
01751                     count++;
01752                 }
01753                 res = sendSlice(parms, arg1, arg2, count, clauses);
01754             } else
01755             res = noteErr("missing slice topo or prefix");
01756             seen++;
01757         } else if (strcasecmp(sw, "-get") == 0) {
01758             if (arg1 != NULL) {
01759                 i++;
01760                 if (arg2 != NULL) {
01761                     // dst is optional, elide if it looks like a switch
01762                     if (arg2[0] != '-') i++;
01763                     else arg2 = NULL;
01764                 }
01765                 res = getFile(parms, arg1, arg2);
01766             } else {
01767                 res = noteErr("missing src file");
01768             }
01769             seen++;
01770         } else if (strcasecmp(sw, "-put") == 0) {
01771             if (arg1 == NULL) {
01772                 res = noteErr("missing src file");
01773             } else if (arg2 == NULL) {
01774                 res = noteErr("missing dst file");
01775             } else {
01776                 i++;
01777                 i++;
01778                 res = putFile(parms, arg1, arg2);
01779             }
01780             seen++;
01781         } else if (strcasecmp(sw, "-putList") == 0) {
01782             if (arg1 == NULL) {
01783                 res = noteErr("missing list file");
01784             } else {
01785                 i++;
01786                 i++;
01787                 res = putFileList(parms, arg1);
01788             }
01789             seen++;
01790         } else if (strcasecmp(sw, "-stats") == 0) {
01791             if (arg1 != NULL && arg2 != NULL) {
01792                 i++;
01793                 i++;
01794                 res = existingRootOp(parms, arg1, arg2, 0);
01795             } else
01796             res = noteErr("missing topo or hash");
01797             seen++;
01798         } else if (strcasecmp(sw, "-delete") == 0) {
01799             if (arg1 != NULL && arg2 != NULL) {
01800                 i++;
01801                 i++;
01802                 res = existingRootOp(parms, arg1, arg2, 1);
01803             } else
01804             res = noteErr("missing topo or hash");
01805             seen++;
01806                 } else {
01807             // can't understand this sw
01808             noteErr("invalid switch: %s", sw);
01809             seen = 0;
01810             break;
01811         }
01812     }
01813     if (parms->splits != NULL) free(parms->splits);
01814     if (parms->root != NULL) SyncRemRoot(parms->root);
01815     SyncFreeBase(base);
01816     if (seen == 0 && res >= 0) {
01817         printf("usage: \n");
01818         printf("    -debug S        set debug level {NONE, SEVERE, ERROR, WARNING, INFO, FINE, FINER, FINEST}\n");
01819         printf("    -v              verbose\n");
01820         printf("    -null           no output\n");
01821         printf("    -ccnb           use binary output\n");
01822         printf("    -binary         use binary output\n");
01823         printf("    -text           use text output\n");
01824         printf("    -cat2           use ccncatchunks2 format\n");
01825         printf("    -mark           print a time code prefix\n");
01826         printf("    -digest         show the digest when doing a put\n");
01827         printf("    -nodup          disallow duplicate segment requests for -put\n");
01828         printf("    -nores          avoid resolve version\n");
01829         printf("    -noseg          no segments\n");
01830         printf("    -nosend         no send of the slice\n");
01831         printf("    -scope N        scope=N for repo commands (default 1)\n");
01832         printf("    -life N         life=N for interests (default 4)\n");
01833         printf("    -bs N           set block size for put (default 4096)\n");
01834         printf("    -bufs N         number of buffers for get (default 4)\n");
01835         printf("    -basic          some very basic tests\n");
01836         printf("    -read F         read names from file F\n");
01837         printf("    -sort F         read names from file F, sort them\n");
01838         printf("    -encode         simple encode/decode test\n");
01839         printf("    -build F        build tree from file F\n");
01840         printf("    -get src [dst]  src is uri in repo, dst is file name (optional)\n");
01841         printf("    -put src dst    src is file name, dst is uri in repo\n");
01842         printf("    -putList L      does checked write of each name, L is file name of name list\n");
01843         printf("    -slice T P C*   topo, prefix, clause ... (send slice to repo)\n");
01844         printf("    -delete T H     delete root with topo T, hash H from the repo\n");
